awd_titl_txt: Travel: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2023 IEEE Conference on Secure and Trustworthy Machine Learning (IEEE SaTML)
awd_abstract_narration:
This grant is to provide travel support for 15 United States-based graduate students to attend the IEEE Conference on Secure and Trustworthy Machine Learning. This conference represents the first stand-alone conference that will expand on the theoretical and practical understandings of the vulnerabilities inherent to machine learning (ML) systems, explore the robustness of ML algorithms and systems, and aid in developing a unified scientific community aimed at creating trustworthy ML systems. The organizers will reserve at least 25% of this travel award for underrepresented groups, particularly women, minorities, and for first-time conference attendees. Participation in such conferences is an extremely important part of the graduate school experience, providing the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers and to be exposed to leading edge work in the field. The support  will enable the participation of students who might otherwise be unable to attend the IEEE SaTML conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This grant was developed to provided travel support for 15 United States-based graduate students to attend the IEEE Conference on Secure and Trustworthy Machine Learning.

This conference represented the first stand-alone conference that expanded on the theoretical and practical understandings of the vulnerabilities inherent to machine learning (ML) systems, explored the robustness of ML algorithms and systems, and aided in developing a unified scientific community aimed at creating trustworthy ML systems.

The organizers reserved at least 25% of this travel award for underrepresented groups, particularly women, minorities, and first-time conference attendees. The organizers of the conference, NIcholas Papernot and Patrick McDaniel, the project PI selected 15 awardees to receive support in the amount of $1,000.00 a piece.  Awardees were selected based on critieria set forth in the project proposal and awards were used to cover expenses airfare, lodging, ground transportation and meals through the process of expense reimbursement. Of the 15 awardees selected, 12 awardees submitted reimbursement for their travel expenses. 

Participation in such conferences is an extremely important part of the graduate school experience, providing the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers and to be exposed to leading edge work in the field. The support was aimed at enabling the participation of students who might otherwise be unable to attend the IEEE SaTML conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.


Last Modified: 04/03/2024
Modified by: Patrick D Mcdaniel
